title: WiFi settings creating reboot loop
content:
Hi there,
I've had my Pixel 3A for over a month now and it's been great and I've upgraded to Android version 10 successfully. 
However I've noticed a potential bug when today I've tried to connect to my works WiFi network. They have certain manual settings to be able to connect, which are below, but when I try to connect after about 1 min it reboots my phone and then after that reboot I go back into WiFi and try to connect again, the same thing happens after about 1 min in. I then turn off WiFi after this and phone is all good and I deleted the work WiFi profile for now. 
Other regular WiFi networks work fine including my home network.

Build version QP1A.190711.020

EAP method: PEAP
Phase-2 Authentication: MSCHAPV2
CA certificate: Do not validate

Could these settings be conflicting with the Pixel 3A hardware? 
Previous versions of Android work on my works WiFi network.

Thanks
Ben
